availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Linville R. Rich (Ballard County, Kentucky, master wagonmaker)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, master wagonmaker. Kentucky native. Son of Jessy Rich. Married to Louisa Rich. Father of Delila Rich, John T. Rich, William Rich, Mary E. Rich, Laura Rich, and Casline Rich. Married to Lucretia Rich. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850. Master wagonmaker in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District No. 3, p. 85. Find A Grave, "Linville R. W. Rich (1833-1909)," Memorial #31011081, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=31011081&ref=acom (accessed September 18, 2017).
